archimate:BusinessObject.name: Alarm Sensor Event
archimate:BusinessObject.documentation:
An Alarm Sensor Event is a type of Sensor Event that indicate some abnormal condition has occured and typically some intervention is required.
Alarm codes are defined by CPI as part of the Digital Membership Architecture for Medicines Manufacturing. They describe the different failure conditions that can occur during medicines manufacturing process, their relative severity (or 'colour'), and the required recovery action.
Alarm codes have been consolidated from a number of sources, including equipment manufacturers. It is envisaged that this list will continue to evolve as the requirements are better understood.
The full list of Digital Membership Alarm Codes is currently defined in the PLANT Domain reference data: - https://github.com/mmic-collaboration/plant-domain-model/tree/development/reference-data
At the time of writing, the current list of Digital Membership Alarm Code Colours is as follows.
A colour to indicate the severity of the triggered alarm, with the recovery action: - RED - Machine Stop, Clear fault condition and trigger reset/restart - YELLOW - Machine Paused, Remove hold condition, machine will resume automatic control. - WHITE - Information, n/a - BLUE - Low Materials Warning, Replenish material stock
Ref: FS01 Data Specification, CPI, martin.keane@cpi-uk.com
